item.title: Infrastructure as a Service Providers
item.description: Cloud computing is widely understood to have three main levels: Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS). The most fundamental of these is IaaS, which forms the basis for the other two. IaaS essentially refers to providing basic hardware and operating system software over the internet. Infrastructure is fairly self-explanatory: it’s the foundational hardware and software needed for computing. When considering cloud infrastructure, the comparison is often made with having your own data center.

item.title: Kluje.com is enhancing its property management bidding e-platform
item.description: Kluje.com, pronounced “clue-jay”, has expanded its online contractor platform to include over 30,000 property agents and facility managers. The platform allows users to easily find qualified contractors for various tasks, such as electrical work, plumbing, and flooring. Jamey Merkel, CEO of Kluje.com, explains that the platform addresses the time constraints faced by real estate and facilities professionals responsible for property upkeep. By streamlining the process of finding and hiring contractors, Kluje.

item.title: Universiti Putra Malaysia is leaving a significant impact on the academic world with its free MOOC platform
item.description: Universiti Putra Malaysia (UPM) is providing a free online learning platform accessible to both Malaysians and a global audience. This platform covers a variety of subjects. UPM highlighted that this new learning format aligns with the current National Higher Education Strategic Plan, which stresses lifelong learning, e-learning, internationalization, and knowledge sharing. PutraMOOC utilizes video lectures, interactive forums, chat features, quizzes, and e-assessments. Students can enroll in Putra Massive Open Online Course (PutraMOOC) online and finish a course in approximately seven to eight weeks.
